results.title: Buffalo 66
results.creator_credit: Vincent Gallo, Chris Hanley and Cinepix Film Properties
results.brief_description: Vincent Gallo made his directorial debut with this comedy drama about convict, Billy Brown, who is released from prison after serving a five year sentence for a crime he did not commit. Bitter and prone to violence, Billy is determined to convince his dysfunctional parents that he has been leading a respectable life doing top-secret CIA work. To give his story credibility, he impulsively kidnaps Layla from a tap-dancing class, forcing her to pose as his wife when he returns home for a visit. Layla strangely takes to the role with enthusiasm and remains with Billy even after the parental visit. Cast includes: Vincent Gallo, Christina Ricci, Anjelica Huston, Ben Gazzara, Kevin Corrigan, Mickey Rourke, Rosanna Arquette and Jan-Michael Vincent.

results.title: Bronenosets Potemkin = Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description:
Made to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the unsuccessful 1905 Revolution, Potemkin initially drew a mixed response in the Soviet Union, condemned by some for its formalism. Its reception abroad ultimately ensured both popular and critical success at home. Nevertheless Potemkin’s influence, if undeniable, has often been overstated. The Odessa Steps sequence’s power to excite rather than move reflects a relatively narrow authoritarian view of art. Eisenstein’s preoccupations with typage in performance and with each change of shot (or succession of changes) in construction had little influence on the development of film narrative. They now seem most relevant to the TV commercial and music clip. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: Director, Sergei Eisenstein ; photography, Edward Tisse.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This renowned Soviet feature portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. An epic dramatisation, it brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist.

results.title: Balloonatic
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Edward Cline and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton stars as a city slicker who is carried into the wilderness by an errant balloon. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Bachelor Girl
results.creator_credit: Rivka Hartman, Ned Lander, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria and Yarra Bank Films
results.brief_description: Dot (Lyn Pierse) is a modern, confident, single woman who writes for a local soap. Content with single life, Dot finds a number of ways to fend off her mother who desperately tries to ‘hook her up’ with various migrating male folk, but Dot is summoned by the boss at the eleventh hour to save a failing plotline… As she and the crew hash-out potential scenarios her personal life escalates in Romance. But will love continue to bloom or will the fanciful story take-over? Contains footage of Melbourne (St.Kilda, Royal Botanic Gardens, Brighton Beach and Victoria Market). Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Bruce Spence, Jan Friedl, Doug Tremlett, Ruth Yaffe, Jane Turner, Tim Robertson, Mark Minchinton, Mark Little, John Flaus and Lynda Gibson.

results.title: Automania 2000
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on problems of automotive design and lack of proper roads and parking facilities. Shows what could happen in the year 2000 when people are forced to live in their cars and the car finally becomes able to reproduce itself. Animator: Harold Whitaker; Writer: Joy Batchelor.

results.title: Austin Powers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, Demi Moore, Jennifer Todd, Mike Myers, Suzanne Todd and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Comedian Mike Myers (Wayne’s World) takes on the dual role of sixties super spy, renowned fashion photographer and insatiable casanova Austin Powers and his arch-enemy Dr Evil in this colourful parody of the James Bond films. Starting off in swinging London of the sixties, the film quickly moves into the present when Austin Powers must travel across time to stop Dr. Evil’s world conquering exploits, who has cryogenically frozen himself (and his cat Mr. Bigglesworth) and resurfaced in the nineties. Much of the films fish out of water humour is based on the difficulty Austin has in adjusting to a modern world that has little tolerance for a promiscuous, sexist, British secret agent with bad teeth and Dr Evil’s thwarted plans to outsmart a society that is far more advanced in notions of evil. Cast also includes Mimi Rogers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York and Robert Wagner.

results.title: Adventures of Jimmy
results.brief_description: A picturesque account of the search of a particularly naive young man for his ideal mate in the big city (San Francisco) and his rather overwhelming success at the film’s conclusion. Though told with tongue in cheek, it has a lot to say about loneliness in a busy world. Stylistically, “Adventures of Jimmy” takes a not undeserved poke at those psychoanalytical literary travelogues so popular in the 1950’s featuring the neurotic as hero. Mr Broughton reads the commentary while Weldon Kees, himself a poet and painter, arranged and plays the musical accompaniment. Written by James Broughton. Photography by Frank Stauffacher.

results.title: Adventures of Dollie
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Kidnapped from her family’s yard by a vengeful gypsy, Dolly is placed in a barrel which travels down a stream and over a waterfall. A young angler fishes the barrel from the river, and the family is reunited. Cast includes Arthur Johnson, Linda Arvidson, Charles Inslee, Madeline West. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: 23 Skidoo
results.brief_description: If you erase the people of downtown America, the effect is bizarre, not to say disturbing. That is what this film does. It shows the familiar urban scene without a soul in sight; streets empty, buildings empty, yet everywhere there is evidence of recent life and activity. At the end of the film we learn what has happened. Awards: London; Cracow; Salerno.
